alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Southern Mountains; Western Canyonlands (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 4:16PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Garfield and south central Wayne Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 415 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Capitol Reef National Park, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Capitol Reef National Park and Caineville. This includes Utah Route 24 between mile markers 89 and 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
